text: Welcome To Common Services Centres The CSC is a strategic cornerstone of the National e-Governance Plan (NeGP), approved by the Government in September, 2006, with an aim to cover all 6 lakhs census villages by one lakh CSCs, as per 1:6 ratio equitably spread across rural India, as part of its commitment in the National Common Minimum Programme to introduce e-governance on a massive scale. Common Services Centres are the access points for delivery of Government-to-Citizen (G2C) e-Services within the reach of the citizen, by creating the physical service delivery ICT infrastructure. It helps in making a transparent service delivery mechanism and reducing citizensâ€™ effort in visiting government offices. - Total No of functional CSCs 5,87,316 - Total No of functional CSCs in Rural 4,57,859 - Total No of functional CSCs in Urban 1,29,457 - Total No of Transactions (in lakh) 450. 01Through the DSP (in lakh) 257. 47 and Non DSP 192. 55 - State wise CSCs as on December 2025 - District wise CSCs as on December 2025 - List of Services 47 and Non DSP 192. 55 - State wise CSCs as on December 2025 - District wise CSCs as on December 2025 - List of Services 55 - State wise CSCs as on December 2025 - District wise CSCs as on December 2025 - List of Services
